intro: Leptolaena masoalensis, commonly known as the Masoalensis hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
